revised_title: Insect Parasitism: Reactions of Endopterygote Insects to an Alien Parasite
tldr: The author investigates the reactions of endopterygote insects, including Tenebrio molitor, Diataraxia oleracea, and Calliphora erythrocephala, to an alien ichneumon fly parasite, Nemeritis canescens. The insects show various defense reactions, such as haemocytic envelopes and melanin deposition, which can lead to the death of the parasite. The study finds that these reactions are distinguishable but do not show significant differences between exopterygote and endopterygote insects.
